author: Special Correspondent
text:
As the bodies of nine Army soldiers, who were buried in an avalanche in the Siachen glacier, were recovered on Tuesday, Chief Minister Jayalalithaa expressed her condolences to their families.

“I was shocked and deeply grieved with the death of the Army soldiers who were involved in guarding the frontiers of the country. I extend my deep condolences to the families of soldiers Elumalai, Kumar, Ganesan and Ramamoorthy [of Tamil Nadu] and have ordered a solatium of Rs. 10 lakh each to their families," Ms. Jayalalithaa said in a statement.

While guarding areas of Siachen glacier on February 3, 10 soldiers of the 19th battalion of the Madras Regiment, including four from Tamil Nadu, were buried in an avalanche. One of them was found alive below 25 feet of snow during a search operation on Monday.
title: CM condoles soldiers’ death
